name: SetTaskDependency
description:
Set a task as waiting on or blocking another task.

Use this tool to establish a dependency between tasks in ClickUp, either setting a task as waiting on another or as blocking one.

parameters.name: task_id_of_dependency
parameters.description: The ID of the task that is waiting on or blocking another task.

value_schema.description: This is the task which is waiting on or blocking another task.

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: Provide the Workspace ID when `custom_task_ids` is true. Necessary for task identification.

value_schema.description:
When the `custom_task_ids` parameter is set to `true`, the Workspace ID must be provided using the `team_id` parameter.
\
For example: `custom_task_ids=true&team_id=123`.

parameters.name: depends_on_task_id
parameters.description: Specify the task ID that this task depends on or is blocked by. It should be a valid task ID in ClickUp.

parameters.name: dependent_task_id
parameters.description: The ID of the task that the specified task depends on or is blocking. This establishes the task dependency relationship.

parameters.name: use_custom_task_ids
parameters.description: Set to true to reference a task by its custom task ID.

value_schema.description: If you want to reference a task by it's custom task id, this value must be `true`.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the clickup API.

parameters.name: custom_task_ids
parameters.description: If you want to reference a task by it's custom task id, this value must be `true`.

value_schema.description: If you want to reference a task by it's custom task id, this value must be `true`.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description:
When the `custom_task_ids` parameter is set to `true`, the Workspace ID must be provided using the `team_id` parameter.
\
For example: `custom_task_ids=true&team_id=123`.

value_schema.description:
When the `custom_task_ids` parameter is set to `true`, the Workspace ID must be provided using the `team_id` parameter.
\
For example: `custom_task_ids=true&team_id=123`.

parameters.name: task_id
parameters.description: This is the task which is waiting on or blocking another task.

value_schema.description: This is the task which is waiting on or blocking another task.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
